circumstances:
The approach to London-Heathrow Airport was started in reduced visibility due to the night and foggy conditions. On final, the aircraft hit the ground, exploded and came to rest in flames short of the runway threshold. Only two passengers survived the crash and were seriously injured while 20 other occupants were killed. 
Crew:
Henri Goblet, pilot,
Jean Lomba, radio operator, 
Louis De Geyndt, steward.
probable_cause: The pilot continued the approach below the minimum safe altitude and was unable to distinguish the ground due to the low visibility caused by night and fog. At the time of the accident, the visibility was 200 yards.
